column2: Okay Rach, that muffin and espresso, $4.50. Ross, double latte, $2.75.\nChandler, coffee and a scone, $4.25. And Pheebs, herbal tea, $1.25. So, all together\nthat\xc2\x92s (pauses to figure the total) $12.75.'
This coming from the man who couldn\xc2\x92t split our 80 dollar phone\nbill in half.'
Hi!'
Hi!'
How much do I owe you for the muffin and the latte?'
Oh that\xc2\x92s on the house courtesy of Joey Tribbiani.'
Oh great! Well, tell him thanks. And since uh, Joey seems like such a\nnice guy, maybe we could go on a date sometime?'
Well, he\xc2\x92s not used to women being so forward with him; but uh, I\ngood check with him\xc2\x97He says it\xc2\x92s okay. (She hands him her card.) Great! Thanks!\nBye-bye!'
Hey Joey, how come our stuff isn\xc2\x92t free?'
It will be when you look like that in a tight skirt! This is great!\nI\xc2\x92m getting more dates than ever!'
Wait a minute, you\xc2\x92re only giving free stuff away to the pretty\ngirls?'
Yeah Joey that is so gross!'
How about a scone on the house baby?'
(giggles) I\xc2\x92m pretty.'
Hey does anyone have any gum?'

Oh I do! (She grabs her huge purse and starts rummaging through it and
taking out various items in a futile search for the gum.) Oh, y\xc2\x92know what? No.
(Pause) Wait a second. (She removes a bag filled with water that has a goldfish swimming
in it.) I know it\xc2\x92s in here somewhere.'
Y\xc2\x92know what? I\xc2\x92m good! I\xc2\x92m good!'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey!'
Hey, what are you doing here? Shouldn\xc2\x92t you be at work?'
(congested) Ugh, they sent me home. They said I can\xc2\x92t work if\nI\xc2\x92m sick.'
Ohh!'
I\xc2\x92m so sorry you\xc2\x92re sick.'
I\xc2\x92m not sick!! I don\xc2\x92t get sick! Getting sick is for weaklings\nand for pansies! '
Honey, no one thinks you\xc2\x92re a pansy, but we do think you need a\ntissue. (She notices something hanging from Monica\xc2\x92s nose, as does Joey.)'
(wiping her nose) I have not been sick in over three years! (Sneezes.) '
I\xc2\x92m gonna grab you some tissue.'
I don\xc2\x92t need a tissue! I\xc2\x92m fine-d! '
When you put a \xc2\x91D\xc2\x92 at the end of \xc2\x91Fine\xc2\x92 you\xc2\x92re\nnot fine.'
I\xc2\x92m fine-d. I\xc2\x92m fine-d! Y\xc2\x92know, it\xc2\x92s a really hard\nword to say.'
Yes?'
Hi, is Rachel here? I\xc2\x92m her sister.'
Oh my God, Jill!'
Oh my God, Rachel!'
Oh my God, introduce us!'
This is Chandler. (Points at him.)'
Hi!'
And you know Monica and Ross!'
Hi Jill.'
And that\xc2\x92s Phoebe (points), and that\xc2\x92s Joey.'
Hey, (in the Joey voice) how you doin\xc2\x92?'
Don\xc2\x92t!! (Joey backs away frightened.) (To Jill) Honey, what are you\ndoing here?!'
(To Ross) Which-which sister is this? Is this the spoiled one or\nthat\xc2\x92s bitter?'
(To Rachel) Daddy cut me off.'
Never mind, I got it.'
And y\xc2\x92know what I said to him? "I\xc2\x92m gonna hire a lawyer and\nI\xc2\x92m gonna sue you and take all your money. Then I\xc2\x92m gonna cut you off!"'
Wow! What did he say?'
That he wouldn\xc2\x92t pay for my lawyer! Then he told me to come here and\nlearn about the value of money from the one daughter he\xc2\x92s actually proud off.'
Oh! Did you hear that?! My dad\xc2\x92s proud of me! My dad\xc2\x92s proud\nof me.'
Rach? (Points to Jill.)'
Oh yeah, sorry. Wait honey, so what did you do that made dad cut you\noff?'
Okay, I bought a boat.'
You bought a boat?'
Yeah but it wasn\xc2\x92t for me, it was for a friend.'
Boy did we make friends with the wrong sister! (Rachel glares\nat him.)'

Jill, honey, I think this is the best thing that could\xc2\x92ve ever
happened to you. I mean you needed to get out on your own anyway! And you know when I did
it, I-I-I at first I was scared, and look at me now! I\xc2\x92m the only daughter dad is
proud of! Okay, well this is, this is what you\xc2\x92re gonna do. You\xc2\x92re gonna get a
job, you\xc2\x92re gonna get an apartment, and then I\xc2\x92ll help you and you can stay with
us. Right Pheebs, she can stay with us?'
Of course, yeah!'
Oh, that\xc2\x92s so great! Okay, I\xc2\x92m really gonna do this! I\ndon\xc2\x92t know how to thank you guys.'
Ooh, I like cards.'
(to a customer) Are you all finished here?'
Yes.'
Great! (Joey takes his cookie and finishes it.)'
Okay, here are the tips for this morning. Jen gets 50, 50 for me, and\nJoey owes eight dollars.'
What?!'
For all the free food you gave away.'
Well if it\xc2\x92s free food, how come you\xc2\x92re charging me for it?'
We don\xc2\x92t give anything away unless it\xc2\x92s someone\xc2\x92s\nbirthday.'
Well, what if they came in third in a modeling contest?'
No!'
(to a woman who came in third in a modeling contest) Sorry! (He grabs her\nmuffin away and returns it to the serving tray.)'
(entering, carrying a bunch of shopping bags) I just had the hardest day.\nThose bags are so heavy. (Sets them down.)'
Jill, how did you pay for all this? I thought your dad took away your\ncredit card.'

Oh please, I memorized those numbers when I was 15. But look at all the
cool make-it-on-my-own stuff I got! (Holds up a red sweater) This is my "Please, hire
me" sweater. (Holds up a pair of black pants) And these are my, "Don\xc2\x92t you
want to rent me this apartment?" pants. '
I don\xc2\x92t think charging new clothes too your dad qualifies as making\nit on your own.'
Oh, Mr. Scientist has to get all technical!'
Seriously, I don\xc2\x92t Rachel\xc2\x92s gonna think it\xc2\x92s a good idea.'
So who made her queen of the world?'
I would love that job!'
(entering) Hey! What\xc2\x92s goin\xc2\x92 on?'
Hey!'
(notices Jill\xc2\x92s bags) Jill! Did you shop?!'
No! They did! (Points to Phoebe and Ross)'
Yeah, we went shopping!'
You went shopping?! What, and then you just came in here and paraded it\nright under Jill\xc2\x92s nose when you know she\xc2\x92s trying to quit. Wow, you guys are\nterrible!'
Sorry Jill.'
Sorry-sorry Jill.'
What\xc2\x92d you get?'
Oh well, all right, I got (Ross hands her a bag) (To Ross) thank you, I\ngot uh, this y\xc2\x92know "I want a job sweater." (Holds up the same sweater.)'
Oh.'
And, and then I got uh, these are apartment pants.'
Apartment pants?'
Yeah, you never heard of them?'
No, of course, of course I\xc2\x92ve heard of them! Ross, what did you\nget?'
Huh? Oh, I got this\xc2\x97(Holds up this pink frilly thing)\xc2\x97this!'
A pajmena?'
Yeah! Oh, I-I love this babies!'
Really?'
Ross, wants a pajmena?'
It\xc2\x92s a rug. (Jill winces.)'
Jill?'
(covers her eyes and starts crying) I\xc2\x92m sorry Rachel, I\xc2\x92m\nsorry\xc2\x85'
Oh, come on! You think that\xc2\x92s gonna work on me?! I invented that!'
Right! But, I am sorry.'

All right, it\xc2\x92s okay. One little setback is okay, just don\xc2\x92t
let it happen again, all right? Now since daddy paid for all this stuff, I should
take it all away. But I\xc2\x92m just gonna take the-the pajmena. (Ross hands it to her.)
And the uh, and the uh pants. Y\xc2\x92know what, I\xc2\x92m just gonna take it all away,
\xc2\x91cause that way you\xc2\x92ll just really learn the lesson. Okay? All righty, I\xc2\x92m
gonna run a couple of errands and I will see you at dinner. (Leaves with all of
Jill\xc2\x92s stuff.)'
She took all my stuff.'
Yeah. Everything but, the little blue one. (Holds it up for her.)'
(gasps) That\xc2\x92s the best one! Oh my God, (hugs him) thank you so much!'
Well. Hey\xc2\x85'
Oh my gosh, that was so lame. Like a pajmena could be a rug!'
Oh yeah, how about you and the, (mimics her fake cry) "I\xc2\x92m\nsorry!"'
(hits him) Shut up! I did not sound like that at all!'
What about, what about when I said y\xc2\x92know about the apartment\npants, how dumb was I?'
Were you this cute in high school?'
Oh stop.'
No you stop!'
No, you stop!'
You stop!'
(gets up and sits between them) Okay-okay, why don\xc2\x92t I sit here and\nyou\xc2\x92ll both stop it!'
Okay, so what do you, what do you want to do? Let\xc2\x92s do something\ncrazy!'
I know, let\xc2\x92s rest and drink lots of fluids. (Holds up a glass of\norange juice.)'
Okay, I\xc2\x92ll rest. But y\xc2\x92know if I\xc2\x92m going to bed, then\nyou\xc2\x92re coming with me.'
That would be impossible to resist if you weren\xc2\x92t all drippy\nhere. (Points to his nose.)'
(wiping her nose) Are you saying that you don\xc2\x92t wanna get with\nthis? (Tries to do a little sexy body rub, but it doesn\xc2\x92t work all that well with the\nbig robe.)'
Yeah, I don\xc2\x92t you should say that even when you\xc2\x92re healthy.'
(in a sexy voice) Come on. (Coughs loudly.)'
Don\xc2\x92t take this personally okay? It\xc2\x92s just that I just\ncan\xc2\x92t have sex with a sick person.'

I\xc2\x92m with you Chandler! I mean I can\xc2\x92t have sex with a sick\nperson either, that\xc2\x92s disgusting! But I\xc2\x92m not sick! Let me prove it to you. We\nare two healthy people in the pribe of libe.'
That\xc2\x92s the thing, see I would like to stay in the pribe of\nmwha-ah-libe.'
Hey!'
Hey.'
What\xc2\x92s up?!'
Umm, I think there\xc2\x92s something you should maybe know.'
Well, it\xc2\x92d better not be about the apartment pants, because I just\npitched the idea to my boss at Ralph Lauren and she loved it.'
No. No. It\xc2\x92s just I was umm, I was with Ross and Jill after you\nleft and umm, I\xc2\x92m pretty sure I saw a little spark between them.'
What?!'
Yeah I mean it\xc2\x92s probably nothing, but I just wanted to warn you\nthat there might be something there.'
With Ross and Jill?'
Yeah!'
With Ross and my sister?'
Yeah.'
With my sister Jill and my ex-boyfriend Ross?'
Yeah.'
Oh there is no way.'
Okay then.'

Oh my God! I can not believe that! I mean I don\xc2\x92t really like it
when Ross goes out with anyone, but my sister isn\xc2\x92t that like incest or something?!
Oh my God, and they\xc2\x92re gonna have sex! Oh! Oh no what if he marries her too?! Oh this
is just terrible, this is just terrible. And I can\xc2\x92t stop it! I can\xc2\x92t\xc2\x97I
don\xc2\x92t own Ross! Y\xc2\x92know? And Jill, she should be able to do whatever it is that
she wants to do! And oh my God, I can\xc2\x92t believe Ross is marrying my little sister,
this terrible. Oh my God, this is just the worst thing that could have ever happened to
me.'
But great news about the apartment pants, huh?'
That\xc2\x92ll be $3.85.'
What do you mean? Yesterday you said I was too pretty to pay for stuff!'
It\xc2\x92s just I can\xc2\x92t because my manager said I\xc2\x85 (Gets an idea)\n(Starts singing) "Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you. Happy birthday dear\nAnnie\xc2\x85'
Amy!'
(still singing) "\xc2\x85Amy! Happy birthday to you!"'
Yeah, not it here it isn\xc2\x92t.'
(entering) Sorry I\xc2\x92m late, what\xc2\x92s up?'
(on the couch) Oh hi! Y\xc2\x92know, I just wanted to see if there were\nany leads on the old job front.'
Oh no! But I just walked past three sales and I didn\xc2\x92t go in. How\nstrong am I?'
That is great. Hey, y\xc2\x92know who doesn\xc2\x92t have to job hunt? Ross.\nHe works at the university. '
Yeah.'
Oh so you know that, you guys talked about that, so you get along, so\nyou think you\xc2\x92re gonna go out?'
Me go out with Ross?! No! God no! What would make you think that?'
I just, Phoebe, said y\xc2\x92know thought she saw something between you\nguys.'
No! I mean he\xc2\x92s nice.'
Yeah.'
He\xc2\x92s the kind of guy you\xc2\x92re friends with, y\xc2\x92know? But\nhe\xc2\x92s not the kind of guy you date. He\xc2\x92s the kind of guy you\xc2\x92d date\nbecause you did. Me, not so much.'
Oh not-not so much. Umm, what-what do you, what do you mean is there\nsomething wrong with Ross?'
Oh no-no-no, he\xc2\x92s just I don\xc2\x92t know, he\xc2\x92s just a little\nbookish.'
Are-are you saying he\xc2\x92s a geek?'
You think so too?'
No! No I, no Ross is not a geek!'
Fine, then let\xc2\x92s just say he\xc2\x92s not my type.'
What handsome is not your type? Smart? Kind? Good kisser? What those\nthings aren\xc2\x92t on your list? Ross is a great guy! You would be lucky to be with him!'
Well okay, if it means that much to you, then I\xc2\x92ll ask him out.'
Oh no-no-no, no-no-no, that\xc2\x92s not what I meant.'
No! Y\xc2\x92know what Rachel? You\xc2\x92re right, y\xc2\x92know he has been\nreally nice to me.'
Yeah but, he\xc2\x92s not your type.'
Yeah but maybe that\xc2\x92s a good thing. Y\xc2\x92know I\xc2\x92m doing all\nthese different sorts of things, and maybe I should try dating a geek too!'

Yeah but, you don\xc2\x92t, you don\xc2\x92t, you don\xc2\x92t want to try to\nmuch too fast. Y\xc2\x92know? I mean, you do remember what happened to the little girl that\ntried to much too fast don\xc2\x92t you?'
What?'
She-she died Jill.'
(still sick) Chandler!'

Oh what is it honey, you need some tea? Some soup? (He gets up from
the couch and goes into the bedroom to find Monica, still in the robe, lying seductively
on the bed. Or at least she\xc2\x92s trying too and as he enters the room, she takes the
robe off on of her legs.) Oh-ohhhh!'
(trying to be seductive) Calling Dr. Big, Dr. Big to the bed.'
Oh Jeez honey, I thought, I thought you were asleep.'
How could I be asleep knowing that you were in the next room.'

I was asleep. (She takes off her robe and starts to shiver) Oh no!\nNo-no honey! Y\xc2\x92know what\xc2\x92s sexy? Layers. Layers are sexy. And blankets are sexy.\nAnd oh! Hot water bottles are sexy.'
Come on, get into bed! I want to prove to you that I\xc2\x92m not sick! I\nwanna make you feel, as good as I feel. (Sneezes.) '
Would you please get some rest!'
I\xc2\x92m fine. (She goes into one of those half sneezing, half-coughing\nfits that you get with a bad cold or flu.)'
(singing) "Happy birthday to you!"'
You\xc2\x92re paying for that.'
What? No-no it\xc2\x92s her birthday!'
You\xc2\x92ve sung Happy Birthday to 20 different women today!'
But it really\xc2\x85'
You are no longer authorized to distribute birthday muffins.'
Damnit! (Storms off.)'
(entering) Rach? Hi!'
Hi!'
Did you tell your sister to ask me out?'
Well yeah\xc2\x85'
Oh wow! I mean, wow! I mean, I-I-I think she\xc2\x92s cute but I-I would\nnever have thought of going out with her, never!'
Really?!'
Yeah but after you said it was okay, I figured, "Why not?!"'
Oh so-so not really never.'

I have to say you are a much bigger person than I am. I mean after all\nwe\xc2\x92ve been through, I just\xc2\x97y\xc2\x92know I wish I had a brother to reciprocate.\nHey, if you ever want to go out with Monica, you have my blessing.'
(overhearing them) Oh-ho, and mine!'
(entering) Chandler, I think I\xc2\x92m sick.'
Really? Struck down in the pribe of libe!'
Okay, fine I admit it! I feel terrible! Would you please rub this on my\nchest? (She hands him some of that Vicks Vap-O-Rub to put on.)'
No-no-no-no-no-no-no, you are not getting me this way.'
Come on! I really need your help!'
No-no-no-no-no!'
Fine, I\xc2\x92ll rub it on myself.'
Okay.'
So you\xc2\x92re just, kinda rubbing it on yourself?'
Yeah?'
It\xc2\x92s nice.'
Are you kidding me?! Is this; is this turning you on?'
Yes! (Hangs his head in shame.)'
I can\xc2\x92t believe it! What is it? Is it the rubbing or the smell?'
It\xc2\x92s all very, very good. (She covers up and sits down.) So you\nwanna go uh, mix it up?'
Not now, I\xc2\x92m sick!'
Oh come on you big faker!'
What happened to your rule about never sleeping with sick people?'
Well that was before all the vaporizing action.'
Okay, if you really wanna have sex\xc2\x85'
Okay! (Runs into the bedroom.)'
Worked like a charm.'
(entering) Hi!'
Hi! Wh-what are you doing here?'
This is where Ross and I are meeting for our date. So, what do you think?\n(She spins to show Rachel the outfit she\xc2\x92s wearing.)'
Well, I-I don\xc2\x92t like it.'
Really?!'
It\xc2\x92s kinda slutty.'
It\xc2\x92s yours!'
Yeah well, I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m a slut.'
(laughs) Me too.'
(entering) Hi Jill!'
Hey!'
Hi (sees Rachel and forgets her name for a moment).'
Rachel.'
Rachel! Well, you-you\xc2\x92re not at home,\nyou\xc2\x92re-you\xc2\x92re-you\xc2\x92re right here.'
Yeah I know, and I bet you thought it would be weird. But it\xc2\x92s not!'
Okay. So well I\xc2\x92ll umm, (To Rachel) I\xc2\x92ll have her home by\nmidnight.'
Why aren\xc2\x92t you home yet?!'
(calling from the bathroom) Is someone there?'
Oh yes, it\xc2\x92s me! Sorry!'
(calling from the bathroom) What are you doing here?'
Uh, I\xc2\x92m just, I\xc2\x92m just looking out your window. At-at the\nview. What are you guys doing?'
We got some Vap-O-Rub in some places.'
(gasps) Oh, he brought her back to his apartment.'
(entering with Chandler) Who? (She looks out the window at Ross\xc2\x92s\napartment) Is that your sister?'
Ugh, she is a slut!'
God, Ross is on a date with your sister! How weird is that?!'
Oh my God, look-look he\xc2\x92s taking off her clothes!'
He\xc2\x92s taking off her coat!'
Oh, this is just terrible. '
Oh no it\xc2\x92s not, no it\xc2\x92s not. It\xc2\x92s a first date. I\xc2\x92m sure\nthat nothing is gonna\xc2\x85(as she is talking we see Ross close his drapes.)'
Oh. (Squeaks again.)'

Ho-oh, he\xc2\x92s gonna get some! (Rachel looks at him.) Of the glare
from the streetlight out of his apartment. Y\xc2\x92know so umm, he\xc2\x92s closed the drapes
there so he can have a nice, pleasant conversation with your little sister. (Pause) Well,
I\xc2\x92m off to bed! (Goes to bed.)'
